<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Good morning </strong>on the last day of May. Or is it June. Are we in 2022 yet? What is time? </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/elon-musk-responds-new-tesla-books-claims?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Musk Takes a Bite Out of Apple
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/elon-musk-responds-new-tesla-books-claims?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tesla CEO Elon Musk talks to media as he arrives to visit the constructi..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTk2L2dlcm1hbnktYXV0b21vYmlsZS10ZXNsYS0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Odd Andersen/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We kick off your Saturday morning with a cartoon—or at least a story that feels like one.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elon Musk, Apple, and a Wall Street Journal reporter found themselves at the center of a social media beef that goes back to Apple's potential acquisition of Tesla in 2016...and previews the electric vehicle fights yet to come.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It all started when a <a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/books/story/2021-07-30/power-play-tesla-book-review?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">review</a> of a new book about Tesla by the WSJ’s Tim Higgins revealed that Elon Musk told the CEO of Apple that <em>he</em> wanted to become the CEO of Apple.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The context:</strong> </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>According to Higgins’s book, Apple boss Tim Cook and Musk were on the phone discussing a potential acquisition of Tesla by Apple. Once Musk lobbed the idea of him running Apple, Cook angrily hung up the phone.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Musk </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1421150913075503112?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">denied</a></span><span> the conversation took place. “Cook & I have never spoken or written to each other ever,” he said on Twitter. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Musk was clearly feeling spicy because later in the day he <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1421152540394143746?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a>, “Apple app store fees are a de facto global tax on the internet. Epic is right.” He’s referencing the lawsuit filed by <em>Fortnite </em>developer Epic Games that attacks Apple’s meaty cut of App Store revenue. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Musk's been at this for a while</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Tuesday, Musk turned an ordinarily dull earnings call for Tesla’s Q2 into a popcorn-and-white-wine event when he <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-tesla-walled-garden-apple-criticism-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=Elon%20Musk%20criticized%20Apple%20twice,walled%20garden%22%20around%20its%20technology.&text=Musk%20then%20faked%20a%20cough%20and%20said%20%22Apple.%22" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">attacked Apple</a> not once but <em>twice</em>. One of those moments:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Our goal is to support the advent of sustainable energy,” Musk said. “It is not to create a walled garden and use that to bludgeon our competitors, which is sometimes used by some companies.” And then he, and we can’t make this up, fake coughed and said “Apple” like a middle school student interrupting class.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why would Musk be angry with a smartphone maker? </strong>Since 2014, Apple has been <a href="https://www.macrumors.com/roundup/apple-car/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">developing</a> an autonomous, electric vehicle that would compete with Tesla, a project Musk has mocked for years. He told the German newspaper Handelsblatt in 2015, “No, seriously, it’s good that Apple is moving and investing in this direction. But cars are very complex compared to phones or smartwatches.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Musk also called Apple a “Tesla graveyard” where employees who couldn’t hack it at his company ended up. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> As the most valuable public company in the world, Apple's got a $2.4 trillion target on its back. Tesla joins Epic Games, Facebook, Spotify, and many other companies trying to chip away at its dominance. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/federal-eviction-moratorium-officially-ends-today?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Requiem for a Moratorium
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The CDC's eviction moratorium ends today, leaving millions of Americans uncertain about their housing future. House Democrats <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/congress-scrambles-extend-eviction-moratorium-saturday-expiration-n1275485?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rushed</a> to extend it yesterday, citing the Delta variant and a lagging rental aid program, but were ultimately unsuccessful.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> President Trump first signed an executive order protecting renters last August, and the CDC handed down a freeze on evictions in September. That moratorium has been extended three times.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Landlords have come out against more extensions, saying they’ve already footed the bill for </span><span><a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/eviction-ban-national-apartment-association-sues-federal-government-for-back-rent/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$27 billion</a></span><span> in unpaid rent.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Another program introduced to help out renters has failed miserably. Out of the $47 billion in rental aid that was approved, only $3 billion had been used as of June. It was up to states to divvy up the money, but they’ve struggled to set up programs to do so.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>some states have already extended their own eviction moratoriums past July, but 8.2 million adults remain behind on their rent or mortgage as of July 5, per the Census Bureau.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/senate-subcommittee-holds-hearing-discuss-overcrowded-national-parks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Smokey Bear Says: Only Congress Can Help Us
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/senate-subcommittee-holds-hearing-discuss-overcrowded-national-parks?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bison walking through traffic on a road outside of Yellowstone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTk0L3llbGxvd3N0b25lX3RyYWZmaWMuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dan Meyers via Unsplash</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Senate subcommittee for National Parks <a href="https://www.mdislander.com/maine-news/senate-panel-holds-hearing-on-congestion-in-national-parks?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">held</a> a hearing Wednesday to discuss how everyone you went to high school with took a hiking vacation this summer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">31+ million people visited a National Park in June alone, resulting in overcrowding and hours-long wait times for trails and entrance into parks.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yellowstone recorded </span><span><a href="https://www.nps.gov/yell/learn/news/21020.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost 1 million visits</a></span><span> in June, up 64% from June 2020 and 20% from June 2019. 2021 is already the park’s busiest year on record.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But parks and their neighboring towns are short on resources. From 2011–2019, US park staff <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-29/national-parks-are-so-crowded-that-congress-is-getting-involved?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decreased 16%</a>. And it’s not just a problem because visitors are bored waiting in line; less staff + huge crowds = more litter and park defacement. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>some parks have already instituted ticketed entry to alleviate congestion, but one of the biggest problems is the amount of actual car traffic in parks. The $1 trillion infrastructure bill currently being negotiated could expand parks' transit services.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ This isn’t going to help matters, but we just think you should know: Entry to all National Parks is <a href="https://www.nps.gov/planyourvisit/fee-free-parks.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">free</a> next Wednesday on the one-year anniversary of the Great American Outdoors Act.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/key-performance-indicators-july-31?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>45% of remote employees work from a couch regularly, according to a <a href="https://craftjack.com/toolbox/remote-work-from-home-statistics-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">study</a> from home improvement marketing firm CraftJack. It gets even crazier: 38% of remote workers work from their bed regularly, 20% work outdoors, and 19%...in a closet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>US Soccer “has spent more than three decades treating the women as an afterthought, discriminating against them through inferior wages and working conditions, and forcing the women to struggle for the equal pay and fair treatment they deserve.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the first time, the US men’s soccer team got <a href="https://www.espn.com/soccer/united-states-usaw/story/4441393/us-soccer-sends-corrosive-message-toward-second-class-uswntsays-mens-union?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">directly involved</a> in the women’s wage discrimination lawsuit against the US Soccer Federation. Representatives for the men’s union wrote that the organization’s treatment toward women “sends a corrosive public message to women and girls.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>For some light weekend reading, here’s how the coronavirus infects cells and why Delta is so dangerous. (<a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-021-02039-y?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nature</a>)</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MONEY MATTERS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/money-matters?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Money Matters: How to Practice Safe Investing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>In this new Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your personal finance questions. </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Submit your money woes here</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stock market index funds are known as the “safe” method of investing, but they can still tank with the market. Are they really a good option for my savings?—Alex from Florida</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stock market index funds can be a great way to grow your savings—in the long-term. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s why investing pros like them: built-in diversification. In a single transaction, you’re investing in hundreds, even thousands, of companies across a variety of sectors. Diversification helps you avoid irreparable, Tower of Terror-esque drops in your portfolio’s value. It’s exactly what the (former?) <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/dude-became-dogecoin-millionaire?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dogecoin millionaire</a> didn’t do.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But if you’re looking to tap into your savings in the next five years, you may want to look elsewhere than the stock market. Like you said, markets sometimes tank (the S&P 500 has dropped more than 10% several times per decade), which is OK if you don’t need the money right away.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, since their inception, the S&P 500, Nasdaq, and the Dow have<em> </em>recovered from every loss <em>and</em> reached new heights.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>PS:</em></strong><em> Later this summer, Ryan will be writing a twice-weekly personal finance newsletter to make you smarter about your money. </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/money-scoop/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Become one of the first subscribers</em></a><em>.</em></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What to watch this weekend: </strong><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h62RmIsx6MA" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Woodstock 99</em></a><em> </em>and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TGLq7_MonZ4" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The White Lotus</em></a><em> </em>on HBO Max, the <a href="https://www.hulu.com/lollapalooza?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lollapalooza livestream</a> on Hulu, and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sS6ksY8xWCY" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Green Knight</em></a><em> </em>in theaters.</p>

But Amazon, which said Thursday that sales growth would slow this quarter, had its worst day since March 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe CDC said “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/skorea-announces-vaccination-plan-18-49-year-olds-2021-07-30/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe war has changed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” in the fight against Covid-19 due to the Delta variant. It suggested the variant is more transmissible than the common cold and could be more harmful than previous strains of Covid. These findings, which were circulated in an internal document, offered justification for the new mask guidance that was issued this Apple\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe kick off your Saturday morning with a cartoon—or at least a story that feels like one.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eElon Musk, Apple, and a Wall Street Journal reporter found themselves at the center of a social media beef that goes back to Apple's potential acquisition of Tesla in 2016...and previews the electric vehicle fights yet to come.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt all started when a \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/books/story/2021-07-30/power-play-tesla-book-review?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereview\u003c/a\u003e of a new book about Tesla by the WSJ’s Tim Higgins revealed that Elon Musk told the CEO of Apple that \u003cem\u003ehe\u003c/em\u003e wanted to become the CEO of Apple.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe context:\u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAccording to Higgins’s book, Apple boss Tim Cook and Musk were on the phone discussing a potential acquisition of Tesla by Apple. Once Musk lobbed the idea of him running Apple, Cook angrily hung up the phone.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMusk \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1421150913075503112?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edenied\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the conversation took place. “Cook \u0026 I have never spoken or written to each other ever,” he said on Twitter. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMusk was clearly feeling spicy because later in the day he \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1421152540394143746?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e, “Apple app store fees are a de facto global tax on the internet. Epic is right.” He’s referencing the lawsuit filed by \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003edeveloper Epic Games that attacks Apple’s meaty cut of App Store revenue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMusk's been at this for a while\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Tuesday, Musk turned an ordinarily dull earnings call for Tesla’s Q2 into a popcorn-and-white-wine event when he \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-tesla-walled-garden-apple-criticism-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=Elon%20Musk%20criticized%20Apple%20twice,walled%20garden%22%20around%20its%20technology.\u0026text=Musk%20then%20faked%20a%20cough%20and%20said%20%22Apple.%22\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eattacked Apple\u003c/a\u003e not once but \u003cem\u003etwice\u003c/em\u003e. One of those moments:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Our goal is to support the advent of sustainable energy,” Musk said. “It is not to create a walled garden and use that to bludgeon our competitors, which is sometimes used by some companies.” And then he, and we can’t make this up, fake coughed and said “Apple” like a middle school student interrupting class.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy would Musk be angry with a smartphone maker? \u003c/strong\u003eSince 2014, Apple has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.macrumors.com/roundup/apple-car/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeveloping\u003c/a\u003e an autonomous, electric vehicle that would compete with Tesla, a project Musk has mocked for years. He told the German newspaper Handelsblatt in 2015, “No, seriously, it’s good that Apple is moving and investing in this direction. But cars are very complex compared to phones or smartwatches.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMusk also called Apple a “Tesla graveyard” where employees who couldn’t hack it at his company ended up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e As the most valuable public company in the world, Apple's got a $2.4 trillion target on its back. Tesla joins Epic Games, Facebook, Spotify, and many other companies trying to chip away at its dominance. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Moratorium\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe CDC's eviction moratorium ends today, leaving millions of Americans uncertain about their housing future. House Democrats \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/congress-scrambles-extend-eviction-moratorium-saturday-expiration-n1275485?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erushed\u003c/a\u003e to extend it yesterday, citing the Delta variant and a lagging rental aid program, but were ultimately unsuccessful.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e President Trump first signed an executive order protecting renters last August, and the CDC handed down a freeze on evictions in September. That moratorium has been extended three times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLandlords have come out against more extensions, saying they’ve already footed the bill for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/eviction-ban-national-apartment-association-sues-federal-government-for-back-rent/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$27 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in unpaid rent.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnother program introduced to help out renters has failed miserably. Out of the $47 billion in rental aid that was approved, only $3 billion had been used as of June. It was up to states to divvy up the money, but they’ve struggled to set up programs to do so.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003esome states have already extended their own eviction moratoriums past July, but 8.2 million adults remain behind on their rent or mortgage as of July 5, per the Census Bureau.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Senate subcommittee for National Parks \u003ca style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheld\u003c/a\u003e a hearing Wednesday to discuss how everyone you went to high school with took a hiking vacation this summer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e31+ million people visited a National Park in June alone, resulting in overcrowding and hours-long wait times for trails and entrance into parks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYellowstone recorded \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nps.gov/yell/learn/news/21020.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealmost 1 million visits\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in June, up 64% from June 2020 and 20% from June 2019. 2021 is already the park’s busiest year on record.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut parks and their neighboring towns are short on resources. From 2011–2019, US park staff \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-29/national-parks-are-so-crowded-that-congress-is-getting-involved?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecreased 16%\u003c/a\u003e. And it’s not just a problem because visitors are bored waiting in line; less staff + huge crowds = more litter and park defacement. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003esome parks have already instituted ticketed entry to alleviate congestion, but one of the biggest problems is the amount of actual car traffic in parks. The $1 trillion infrastructure bill currently being negotiated could expand parks' transit services.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ This isn’t going to help matters, but we just think you should know: Entry to all National Parks is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nps.gov/planyourvisit/fee-free-parks.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efree\u003c/a\u003e next Wednesday on the one-year anniversary of the It gets even crazier: 38% of remote workers work from their bed regularly, 20% work outdoors, and 19%...in a closet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote: \u003c/strong\u003eUS Soccer “has spent more than three decades treating the women as an afterthought, discriminating against them through inferior wages and working conditions, and forcing the women to struggle for the equal pay and fair treatment they deserve.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the first time, the US men’s soccer team got \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/soccer/united-states-usaw/story/4441393/us-soccer-sends-corrosive-message-toward-second-class-uswntsays-mens-union?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edirectly involved\u003c/a\u003e in the women’s wage discrimination lawsuit against the US Soccer Federation. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eIn this new Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSubmit your money woes here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStock market index funds are known as the “safe” method of investing, but they can still tank with the market. Are they really a good option for my savings?—Alex from Florida\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStock market index funds can be a great way to grow your savings—in the long-term. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere’s why investing pros like them: built-in diversification. In a single transaction, you’re investing in hundreds, even thousands, of companies across a variety of sectors. Diversification helps you avoid irreparable, Tower of Terror-esque drops in your portfolio’s value. It’s exactly what the (former?) \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/05/dude-became-dogecoin-millionaire?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edogecoin millionaire\u003c/a\u003e didn’t do.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut if you’re looking to tap into your savings in the next five years, you may want to look elsewhere than the stock market. Like you said, markets sometimes tank (the S\u0026P 500 has dropped more than 10% several times per decade), which is OK if you don’t need the money right away.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, since their inception, the S\u0026P 500, Nasdaq, and the Dow have\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003erecovered from every loss \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e reached new heights.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong
